name: Start of primary & secondary school academic year (approx.)
impact_on_supply_chain: School-related demand (uniforms, books, transport) starts ramping up.
notes: Academic year in Bangladesh generally runs Jan–Dec; exact dates should be confirmed from DPE 2023 calendar.

name: Bishwa Ijtema 2023 – Phase 1 (13–15 Jan)
impact_on_supply_chain: Huge temporary population inflow; heavy pressure on roads and public transport; strong demand for food, water, sanitation and informal trade.
notes: Event spans 3 days; treat as event window in models rather than single day.

name: Bishwa Ijtema 2023 – Phase 2 (20–22 Jan)
impact_on_supply_chain: Similar logistical pattern to Phase 1: congestion, increased FMCG demand, temporary stalls.
notes: Use as second event window close to Dhaka markets.

name: Pohela Falgun & Valentine's Day
impact_on_supply_chain: High footfall in parks, campuses, restaurants; strong demand for flowers, gifts, fashion, F&B.
notes: Good candidate for positive demand shock in urban FMCG & services.

name: Language Martyrs' Day / International Mother Language Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Processions and official ceremonies; government offices closed; minor disruption in logistics, especially in Dhaka.
notes: Can model as national_holiday dummy; demand effects depend on sector.

name: Shab-e-Barat
impact_on_supply_chain: Night prayers and visits to cemeteries; some businesses adjust hours; next-morning activity may be reduced.
notes: Mainly timing effect on working hours and urban mobility.

name: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's Birthday & National Children’s Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Government offices closed; ceremonies and gatherings; light impact on private-sector logistics.
notes: Include as national_holiday dummy.

name: Start of Ramadan 1444 (approx.)
impact_on_supply_chain: Shift of consumption to evening/night (iftar, sehri); strong demand for food, drinks, cooking ingredients; daytime productivity may drop.
notes: Model as month-long behavioural regime change rather than single-day event.

name: Independence and National Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Large rallies and parades; government offices closed; urban congestion in Dhaka; moderate logistics disruption.
notes: Important national_holiday dummy with possible boost in FMCG demand.

name: Bengali New Year (Pohela Boishakh)
impact_on_supply_chain: One of the biggest cultural festivals; very high spending on clothes, food, drinks, entertainment; streets very crowded.
notes: Strong positive demand shock in retail; possible delivery delays in dense urban cores.

name: Shab-e-Qadr (Laylat al-Qadr)
impact_on_supply_chain: Night-long prayers; working hours may be affected; higher late-evening mobility around mosques.
notes: Treat as timing effect; may amplify late-Ramadan shopping.

name: Jumatul Bidah (last Friday of Ramadan)
impact_on_supply_chain: Crowded mosques, peak pre-Eid shopping; high traffic; some offices close or operate reduced hours.
notes: Use as pre-Eid peak demand marker.

name: Eid ul-Fitr
impact_on_supply_chain: Major exodus from cities to villages before Eid; on the day itself most formal commerce pauses; pre-Eid days have extremely high demand.
notes: Model both Eid day and the preceding travel window; strong transport congestion and mode shifts.

name: Eid ul-Fitr Holiday (2nd day)
impact_on_supply_chain: Many workers still away; urban retail partially closed; inter-district bus and rail still packed.
notes: Part of Eid holiday block; treat together with 22 Apr.

name: Labour Day / May Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Rallies and union events; some factories and offices closed; start of heavy pre-monsoon/monsoon rain risks.
notes: Combine with early-monsoon disruptions on construction and road logistics.

name: Buddha Purnima
impact_on_supply_chain: Localised temple gatherings; some local businesses close; small but visible local demand shifts.
notes: More relevant in Chattogram and hill districts; treat as regional dummy if you have geo granularity.

name: Eid-ul-Adha Holiday (day before Eid)
impact_on_supply_chain: Livestock trading at peak; heavy inter-city travel; logistics and cold-chain capacity under pressure; monsoon rains can cause flooding.
notes: Include full Eid-ul-Adha window (27–29 Jun) as contiguous shock period.

name: Eid-ul-Adha
impact_on_supply_chain: Major meat consumption and distribution; high demand for refrigeration and electricity; many shops closed except essentials.
notes: Important for perishable supply chains (meat, ice, cold storage).

name: Eid-ul-Adha Holiday (2nd day)
impact_on_supply_chain: Continued family visits; many businesses still closed or partially open; ongoing transport load.
notes: Treat 27–29 Jun as a single Eid-ul-Adha block in dummy coding.

name: Bank Holiday (start of financial half-year)
impact_on_supply_chain: Banks closed for internal closing; can delay payments to suppliers and payroll; monsoon rains may exacerbate transport delays.
notes: Affects financial flows rather than physical supply, but still relevant for invoice timing.

name: Ashura (10 Muharram)
impact_on_supply_chain: Processions and gatherings; some roads temporarily blocked; heavy rain risk during monsoon.
notes: Localised congestion; treat as one-day dummy in monsoon season.

name: Severe monsoon rains and landslides Aug 2023 (approx. 5–20 Aug)
weather_basis: Dhaka Aug climate normals used as proxy
impact_on_supply_chain: Floods and landslides blocked roads and damaged infrastructure; export logistics via Chattogram port disrupted; local retail shortages possible.
notes: Use a regional weather-shock dummy for affected districts over the reported period.

name: National Mourning Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Commemorative events; public offices closed; not typically a strong consumption festival.
notes: Mostly affects government services and official activities.

name: Dhaka Elevated Expressway – Airport–Farmgate section opened
impact_on_supply_chain: Medium/long-term reduction of travel time on this corridor; potential improvement in freight reliability to/from airport and northern districts.
notes: Create a post-2-Sep indicator for transport improvements affecting Dhaka corridor flows.

name: Janmashtami
impact_on_supply_chain: Temple visits and processions; localised congestion; some shops in Hindu areas closed.
notes: Regional/segment-specific effect, especially on jewellery, sweets and garments.

name: Eid-e-Miladunnabi (Mawlid)
impact_on_supply_chain: Religious gatherings and processions; some businesses closed; rainfall still relatively high.
notes: Model as one-day religious holiday in late monsoon.

name: Dhaka–Bhanga railway via Padma Bridge opened for passengers
impact_on_supply_chain: New rail route potentially shifts some passenger and freight from road/ferry to rail; improves connectivity to south-western districts.
notes: Add a post-10-Oct dummy for routes using the Padma corridor.

name: Durga Puja – Vijaya Dashami
impact_on_supply_chain: High festival spending on garments, gold, sweets and gifts; crowds near pandals; traffic diversions.
notes: Treat as peak of a multi-day festival window (around 4–5 days) for demand analysis.

name: BNP mass rally in Dhaka with violent clashes
impact_on_supply_chain: Serious clashes with security forces; road blockages; urban commerce heavily disrupted for at least the day.
notes: Add a one-day shock dummy; also consider spillover days before/after in Dhaka sales and logistics.

name: Start of nationwide blockades and hartals (late Oct–Nov)
weather_basis: Dhaka Nov climate normals as average for period
impact_on_supply_chain: Repeated road, rail and river blockades; major fall in truck movement; route cancellations; big economic loss estimates.
notes: Model this as a multi-week protest/blockade regime (e.g., Oct 29–Nov 20) dummy rather than one day.

name: Victory Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Parades and official events; pleasant, dry weather; minimal weather-related disruptions.
notes: Useful as national_holiday dummy in dry season.

name: Christmas Day
impact_on_supply_chain: Localized demand spike for Christmas-related goods; generally, business as usual for non-Christian segments.
notes: Effect concentrated in certain urban pockets (churches, Christian institutions).

name: End of primary & secondary school academic year (approx.)
impact_on_supply_chain: End-of-year exams and closures; demand shifts to private coaching, family travel, and festive season.
notes: Exact term-end dates should be confirmed from DPE and individual boards for precise modelling.
